content: first constraint should be updated to "1 ≤ N ≤ 60" because N is 1 in some test cases
Love it! I think this would also be a good problem for shortest code, but that's up to you. My only critique is that there is no explicit constraint given for the lengths of words given.
Please let me know what is wrong before you reject - I will try to address your issue. Thank you!

Added the constraint. Thank you!

My concern for Shortest was the difficulty of getting it short within 15 minutes - I based it off of asking myself, "If I got this in a clash, would I enjoy doing it?" and I think I concluded no after thinking about how heavily I had to debug the solution I wrote under normal circumstances.

But I guess if more people think it is okay, I can add it in as well.

fixed it.
You should be able to edit too. Are you?
Nice, thx. Yes, I could've changed it, too, but I don't want to fiddle around too much with puzzles that aren't mine. :)

In cases when it's an obvious mistake like this one, you should edit.

Even when it's not an obvious mistake, but a contribution is not approved recently then there is a good chance that author is gone so I would recommend to just edit. Maybe include previous version of edited parts so it can be rollbacked.

But yes, I know what you mean. It feels rude to be doing that.
i think a shortest mode would be a good idea, if you're counting votes ;-)
